name: Dropdown

jtbd.functional: Present a list of options on demand. Allow users to select from a set of actions or choices without cluttering the interface with all options visible at once.
jtbd.affordance: Floating panel that appears below a trigger element. Users recognize this as a menu of options — each item is clearly interactive with hover states. Dividers group related options.
jtbd.emotional: Keeps the interface clean. Options are available when needed but hidden when not, reducing visual noise and decision fatigue.

anatomy.menu: .t-dropdown__menu — Absolutely positioned floating panel with border and shadow

accessibility.ariaExpanded: Trigger button uses aria-expanded to communicate open/closed state
accessibility.keyboard: Enter/Space opens menu. Arrow Down/Up navigates items. Enter selects. Escape closes. Home/End for first/last item.
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus moves to first item on open. On close, focus returns to trigger.
accessibility.screenReader: Menu role announced on open. Each item announced with its label. Active item announced with aria-current.

knownIssues: Open/close behavior requires JavaScript — CSS cannot toggle visibility
No typeahead search within menu items
Collision detection (menu overflowing viewport) not handled
